      protected AbstractNumberValidationRuleDTO(N max, N min, String detailedDescription, String unitName)
      Constructor, allows us to set the internal abstract fields.
      Parameters:
      max - The upper bound allowed for the field
      min - the lower bound allowed for the field
      detailedDescription - Detailed description of the field definition.
      unitName - Used to define the units within the field, the same field might be in degrees, radians, etc..

      public boolean equals(Object toCompare)
      Compares the supplied object to this one, it checks the supplied object is a FieldDefinition and then checks the definition applies validation, its name and description to see if they are matching objects.
      Overrides:

      Parameters:
      toCompare - the object to compare (can be null or a child class, etc..)
      Returns:
      false if the name/validation and description fields in a field definition are different (or it isn't a field definition).

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid(Object toTest)
      This will compare the incoming object and see if it is a valid whole number and if the value is a valid number do we have a maximum or a minimum data range? If there is a upper or lower value (they can be null) then it tests the supplied object is less than/equal or greater than/equal as appropriate.

      If validationOptional is set to true this will return true by default (no further checks).

      Specified by:
      isValid in interface uk.pallas.systems.typr.entities.v1.validation.ValidationRule
      Parameters:
      toTest - to test is valid
      Returns:
      false if the object isn't a number or if it falls out the expected data range.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid(Number toTest)
      This will compare the incoming object and see if it is a valid whole number and if the value is a valid number do we have a maximum or a minimum data range? If there is a upper or lower value (they can be null) then it tests the supplied object is less than/equal or greater than/equal as appropriate.

      If validationOptional is set to true this will return true by default (no further checks).

      Specified by:
      isValid in interface uk.pallas.systems.typr.entities.v1.validation.number.NumberValidationRule<N extends Number>
      Parameters:
      toTest - to test is valid
      Returns:
      false if the object isn't a number or if it falls out the expected data range.
